comments.text:
When I was a little kid, I went and saw this movie in the theater with my 
sister. I found the moving to be boring, for the most part. Just being 
honest. But this number was an unexpected exception. That theater was loud, 
and I couldn't resist as the movie's antagonist surprisingly was the one to 
coax up a few legit goose bumps on me with her powerful voice and 
invigorating song and performance.﻿

comments.text:
+THE MAN
Nothing wrong with corny, and it is deeper than you're willing to see. The 
stage version is, I'll own, more fun, but the movie is packed with good 
points, including the performances of all concerned, the music score and 
arrangements, the costumes, and so much more-- plus, unlike in the stage 
version, Toto gets to come along!

A master piece of a scene!!!

comments.author: Jesse Erickson

comments.text:
This is basiclly the best song but Ease On Down the Road is in between 1st 
and 2nd place. But its really in 2nd place because I really love the song 
No Bad News. But I also like You Cant Win by Michael Jackson. But the song 
is You Cant Win is in 3rd place for me. But I think that Slide Some Oil To 
Me will probably not be worst than Home. Even though Home actually is 
serious and not funny. Its something my brother hates very much. Dont know 
how to convince my brother into liking it but its just him. Anyways these 
are my rankings for the songs:

Home: 4th place. I dont know why but it is kinda boring for me. And serious.

You Cant Win: 3rd or 2nd. Im more of a 2nd place person for this.

Slide Some Oil To Me: 5th. I kinda hate this song a lot. 

Ease On Down The Road: 1st or 2nd. Its not exactly 1st but I pick 1 1/2.

No Bad News: 1st. Its so intresting how Mabel King uses her voice. Reminds 
me of Louie Armstrong singing La Vie En Rose!

I have one more song

I forgot the name but it has something to do with motorcyle monkeys or the 
graffiti munchkins.

Ah ha!! Got it! The graffiti munchkins!

The song they sing is so wonderful and I can never stop singing it but it 
cant beat No Bad News. In my opinion in ranking its 3rd. I dont know why. 
Its not as good as No Bad News or You Cant Win. 

Ok im off to do a Wizard of Oz!!!
comments.author: AJ LeeForever

comments.text:
Maybell King, Rodge & Dee's Mama. My favorite show besides Good Times, 
That's My Mama, Bionic Woman, & Soul Train, When I was seven. Soul Train 
was very informative, where else can a seven year old ( white ) Brooklyn 
girl, discover the wonders of Afro Sheen, Dark & Lovely, & Queen Of Sheeba 
Cosmetics, along with the latest, ( best ) dance moves. That Summer I 
convinced my best friend  Trina to corn row my hair, because I liked the 
colorful beads. Before Bo Derreck, there was me, a white girl, in a 
wheelchair, with beaded braids down to my waist & bangs in the front. I was 
kinda hard to miss around the neighborhood.﻿

comments.author: Denise Cole

comments.text:
47 people were brought bad news. On a side note R.I.P. Mabel King 
(1932-1999). Some trivia: In the scene where she calls the Flying Monkeys 
that happens a few minutes after this scene. When the leader Cheetah speaks 
he says to her "What's Happening!!" When I got older I realized was that 
breaking the fourth wall there? Because Mabel King starred as Mabel 'Mama' 
Thomas in the famous 1970's sitcom What's Happening!! I wonder if Harry 
Madsen the actor who played Cheetah improvised that or if that was really 
in the script.﻿
comments.author: BayareaGuy06

comments.text:
And it's interesting to note that the sequel series, "What's Happening 
Now!!", did a "Wizard of Oz" fantasy sequence. However, Mabel was not 
involved as she wasn't in that series.
comments.author: MaskedMan66
